choices: THe SHerrif begins to grow right there and now
115321112111.content:
After a hard day of smashing Rock, the former Sheriff of Nottingham laid on his hard wooden bed with his head laying on his flat stale pillow in his cold deary cell, trying to fall asleep. But despite all the labor he has done for, the conditions of his current surroundings made it impossible, it didn't help his big stomach was growling like a mad lion underneath his prison stripe shirt.

"Ah, shut up," growled Bushel britches to 'himself', "It been along day, and I need sleep. In the mornin, we will have some bread and water." His stomach gurgled violently to that last comment. "Well what did you expect? We're nobodies now! We used to be law in this horseless town. All we had to do is boss people around and collect taxes for Prince John.. with a cut for ourselves, as well as a nice fancy room and all the food we can stomach... but now; we are just no bodies in prison..."

"Hey, Sheriff!" shouted Nutsy, the former buzzard lieutenant of the pudgy wolf, "Er, former Sheriff. You gots a birthday package... don't know why they would though..."

Oh right, it was his birthday, the days in jail just flew by. With a heavy grunt, the wolf got on his feet and turn to his former bird goon standing on the other side of the bar. The former goon of his was holding a plain looking box.

PLEASE be a cake or something, the former Sheriff hope has was handed the package through the bars, which were dashed when he lifted the box lid.

It was a small vile of juice... with a note.

Bushel Britches took the note and read it

"Happy Birthday, My Big boy.
Heard of your trouble, and thought a drink made with a little love will help you out grow your troubles.
Love, Aunt Notty"

Aunt Notty.... Bushel britches BARELY remember her, back when he was a bouncing baby brat. His family kept a distance from her, saying she was a nut and believed in magic and such nonsense...

The Sans-Sherrif of Nottingham took a look at the drink his Aunt sent. It was pretty much see through, like watered down juice. Opening it up, the smell as strangely strong that made his wolf-nose curled.
"Ugh... well... it maybe not cake, but better than nothing." He said to himself, he then looked down at the stomach, "And if anything happens, I blaming you and your complaining." Raising the juice up high, the SHeriff made his personal toast, "Happy Birthday to me... down the hatch."

With one simple swing of the glass, the entire vial was in the wolf's big mouth, barely even filling up half it. Surprisingly, the foul smelling drink had a strong sweet taste to it. Savoring the textures for awhile, the Sheriff gulp the mysterious concoction, fouled by a loud belch.

And though it wasn't very filling, the Sheriff felt strangely warm than he was once before. Behind his barred windows, the Sheriff saw the full moon shinning down. It looks like a giant silver coin... though strangely enough, his thoughts went to think of chocolate silver coins now... Either way, despite being in a cage, the Sheriff somehow felt more free then ever... like everything is beneath him somehow...
115321112111.title: Big Ol Bushel Britches gets bigger

"Oh of course!" the pink colored bear with the image of a rainbow on her tummy said "Anything to help out the poor unhappy children!" then Tommy came racing into the science lab having overheard everything his father was really planning "No wait Cheer don't do it!" but too late she already drunk half of the potion and unknowingly to the three of them that particular formula was designed to actually enlarge the properties of anything that consumed it sure enough Cheer felt a odd rumbling in her tummy then she slowly begin growing bigger in height she broke the chair she sat on and overfilled the lab her furry face in shock "On my..what's happening? Why am I suddenly getting bigger?" she cried out as the scientist and his son stared jaw dropped as the furball Bear of feelings over shot the roof in their house "Oops I'm very sorry!" she cried out as she grew to the overwhelming size of 50 feet at the sound of a nearby roof exploding half the neighbours were staring and gasping in shock at the pink Care Bear giantess now trying to desperately free herself from being stuck what does Cheer Bear do now?

Tommy's evil father only snickered "Oh no I'm not doing that No Heart promised me a huge reward if I captured one of you furry lumps of feelings and delivered you to him and that's what I plan on doing!" with that he took out a remote control device from his side pocket meant to take control of the girl bear but he found to his shock he couldn't get it to work properly Cheer put him back down before locking him in a rainbow cage made from her magical tummy symbol "There that should hold you I'm sorry Tommy about your dad but he's a very bad person to work for No Heart now with your help I should get back to Care-A-Lot but how will my friends see me at this size?" suddenly a different sound could be heard from the Care Bear's depths her stomach that is as it made terrifying groaning sounds that shook the ground most of the people screamed and ran for shelter "Uh Oh! 12133.title: Classic Storyline

121331.content:
The Brain was busy working on his latest science project; determined to get top grades he decided to tackle something that had not been done before. He had set it up in the attic at Authur's house seeing as how they were both assigned to work on the same assignment and his own attic was already choc-a-bloc with an array of scientific nic-nacks. He plugged the last lead into the remaining USB port and prepared to test his shrink ray. Powering up, aiming for the item (an aubergine) and, just as it reached full power, he fired the laser... and blasted the aubergine into a poached jam.

"Oh man!" He groaned as he went about scraping all the goo up. "That the second time I've done that today."

Outside Authur, Buster, Francine and Muffy were practicing baseball with Francine at the bat, Authur pitching and Buster and Muffy fielding. There was one problem with their practice that got under Francine's skin in particular, Muffy spent more time worrying about getting her clothes dirty than she did actually fielding.

There was one point where they managed to get a break but The Brain was still fretting over why he ended up splattering aubergine all over the place when his so-called shrink ray was actually functioning. Once the break was over they all went back to what they were doing except for The Brain who went off to try and sort out the problem with his science project mathematically. At one point Francine got such a good swing that the ball smashed through the attic window and knocked right into the shrink ray causing imminent activation. The smashing did not go unnoticed as Jane Read soon stepped out of the house.

"Arthur." She called out. "You and your friends have gone too far. Get that ball out of the attic and then maybe you can get started on your homework." With that she returned to her accounting while the four of them groaned.

"Come on, Buster," Arthur commented, "Let's recover the ball, and maybe she'll calm down if we clear up the glass." Shrugging his shoulders Buster followed Arthur indoors as Francine and Muffy looked on.

"Shall we go?" Asked Muffy, Francine shook her head and replied.

"That was my ball. I'm not budging from this spot until I get it back." Muffy now thought if she should just set off anyway or remain; she figured it would be better for her reputation to wait.

Arthur and Buster poked their heads round the door to see the science project in question.

"Is this something left by aliens?" Buster asked, Arthur groaned.

"Of course not." He answered. "It's mine and The Brain's science project. He hasn't really told me what it's about ye..." Just then the machine fired at the both of them, causing them to yelp in surprise. In another part of the room there were soft furnishings that could fit in a matchbox.
121331.title: Funny, I Shrunk the Kids

choices: Jane sits down and notices the sofa is missing (Original Plot)
Jane sees that something else is amiss (Different Plotline)
1213311.content:
After several minutes Francine was getting impatient.

"How along does it take to fetch a baseball?" She asked out loud. "I'm expected back home in a quarter of an hour. Oh well." With that she made for the front door and Muffy, after thinking about the implications, decided she might as well follow.

Both girls poked the heads round the door, bewildered at the sight of what The Brain had been working on, and then the machine fired for the last time that day. Blinking from the burst of light Francine and Muffy attempted to get their bearings in what seemed like a grand hall at first but, after further observation, they realised that it was the same attic that they had just walked into. As the realisation that they were now ant-size began to sink in Arthur and Buster began running towards them from another part of the attic.

"What going on here?" Francine asked.

"Well," Arthur commented, "I don't know why The Brain has been working on something that shrinks things. What's the benefit anyway?"

"Hmph." Groaned Muffy. "A fine afternoon this turned out to be." Just then footsteps could clearly be heard coming up the stairs into the attic; realising the implications Arthur and Francine ran across to where the shrunken sofa was, calling for the other two to follow.

As they gathered round the sofa Francine told them to move across to the more open part of the attic and, in spite of the qualms they had with her bossy voice, complied. They had barely gone ten paces when Jane entered the attic; for a few moments they were all distracted as they noticed that Arthur's mum now looked like Godzilla and, seeing her stroll in their direction, Arthur swallowed and told them to hurry up as they completed their manouveur, after very nearly being stepped on, and clambered on top of the sofa to try and can the giant aardvark's attention.
1213311.title: Tiny Kids, Giant Mother

141.content:
(Since it's taken us a few choices to get to this point, I'll start with the beginnings of the scenario and you guys can choose whether or not to follow it from here.)

As usual, Bugs Bunny was in trouble! This time he was being chased through the desolate desert by none other than Wile E. Coyote, supergenius! Normally, the rascally rabbit had a number of tricks up his sleeve to ensure that he always came out on top, but this particular maroon was hard to shake. Wile E. was bigger than him, smarter than him (for the most part), and definitely more determined than him. It seemed that, after all this time, Bugs had met his match.

That is, until he found the building.

It was an unassuming building, really, just a metal box with one door, no windows and a flat roof. There were antennae surrounding it, blinking lights, the works. It didn't look like much, except it was really out in the middle of nowhere, where no one should be.

Bugs looked behind him to make sure he wasn't being chased. The coyote, for once, was no where in sight. Well, he thought, there's no harm in taking a look around. This place might even be a good place to hide out for the time being. Cautiously, he snuck from a rock outcropping to a cactus, and from the cactus to a fence. Impossibly, he hid behind one of the metal posts along the fence before sneaking inside the property. Skimping on carrots the way he had been brought some advantages, at least.

Everything was quiet as he snuck up to the building. He placed one gloved paw on the door knob before twisting it open. He put his ears through the crack at first, and then one eye. "Hello?" he called out. "Anybody home?" There was no answer.

That was all he needed; he threw open the door and walked in. Then he thought the better of it and closed the door behind him. It wouldn't do to give away his possible hiding spot to the Coyote.

Once he flipped the light switch, he found himself inside of some kind of abandoned laboratory. Test tubes and beakers rested on desks and in sinks, and there were all kinds of electronics as well. One particular set of test tubes caught his attention, probably because they were the only ones to have labels: Giant Growth, Shrinking Powder, Super Strength and Super Speed were the four he could read. They were all filled with some white powder he supposed you needed to swallow. The fifth, also white, was unmarked.

At the far end of the room, a futuristic ray gun lay on the floor in front of the mirror. He grinned at himself. "You handsome devil, you." Then he looked at the gun; there was a dial on it with two settings: Grow, and Shrink. Whoever was here sure was obsessed with size-changing, that's for sure. Bugs picked it up, and suddenly had an idea. Wouldn't this be a great thing to use against that 'super-genius'? Here he had a full lab at his disposal! Who knows what kind of trouble he could cook up?

His sharp ears heard some movement outside. In a flash, Bugs was hidden underneath a desk with his new toy. "Rabbit?" He could make out the somewhat distant voice of Wile E. Coyote entering the yard. "Where are you? I know you're somewhere nearby. I have an excellent sense of smell you know." The smugness in the coyote's voice convinced the bunny that some comeuppance was in order.

But what was he to do?
141.title: Looney Toons

15113212.content:
Next we'll check what you wish to remove from the canon. Starting with the option that most appeals to me.

Hail the Ponies: This acknowledges only 42 episodes out of a total of 65; those removed are Return of Harmony, Secret of My Excess, The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000, Hearts and Hooves Day, Putting Your Hoof Down, It's About Time, Dragon Quest, Hurricane Fluttershy, A Canterlot Wedding, The Crystal Empire, Too Many Pinkie Pies, One Bad Apple, Magic Duel, Wonderbolts Academy, Apple Family Reunion, Spike at Your Service, Keep Calm and Flutter On, Just for Sidekicks, Games Ponies Play and Magical Mystery Cure. (Notes: Two-parters are listed as one but count as two. Some are rejected either to make up numbers, because of fridge logic or because they link back to another rejected episode.)
15113212.title: Fanon Discontinuity

151132121.content: Now, will the story be primarily about growth or about shrinking?
151132121.title: Choice of Size

1511321212.content:
Twilight had been studying hard. Princess Celestia sent her a new topic of magical practice, namely size-alteration. In all her years as a student Twilight couldn't recall ever hearing about an actual spell to change size; there were a multitude of transfiguration spells and a plethora of stories for unicorn foals about giants and shrinking, but never anything that pointed to such things being possible. Now she decided to make her attempt. She focused hard and thought about the apple in front of her, trying to focus on it being downsized without affecting its molecular structure.

"HI!" Pinkie Pie blurted out as she burst into the library with Applejack, Rainbow Dash and Rarity in tow. The sudden interruption startled Twilight, causing her to lose control of the thaumic energy she'd been building and, in a flash, she suddenly found herself alone.

---

"Hey!" Pinkie yelled up. "There's no need for that!"

"What they hay are ya on about?" Applejack asked in confusion. Suddenly she felt a series of earthquakes and turned to see four great columns of a light purple colour; she hesitantly looked up just as...

"IS ANYPONY THERE?" Twilight asked, unaware of how powerful her voice was to her friends in their new predicament. She towered over them now, having accidentally miniaturised them to the size of ants.
1511321212.title: Princess, I Shrunk my Friends

choices: Something stops her from making it.
15113212121.content:
"Of all things that could happen," Rarity bemoaned, "This is. The. Worst. Possible. THING!"

"Any more offers?" Rainbow Dash groaned over Rarity's dramatics. "It's perfectly simple. I'll just fly up to her ear and let her know what's going on?"

"Unless her strides exceed yer flyin' speed." Applejack pointed out, prompting Rainbow to laugh as the ground quaked again from Twilight's hoof-falls.

"This is Rainbow Dash your talkin' about." She answered. "Fastest flyer in all Equestria. I might be a bit shrimpy to do a Sonic Rainboom now, but I bet I could match anypony's speed nonetheless."

"Aw, come on, Rainbow." Pinkie Pie pouted. "If Twilight finds us now, it'll ruin the drama of the story." Prompting the other three to look at her in a bemused fashion.

"Whatever." Rainbow shrugged it off and shot up just as one of Twilight's hooves crashed down closer than ever.

"Huh, WHO KNOWS WHAT KINDA PROBLEMS THAT COULD'VE LED TO." Twilight boomed. "PONIES DROPPING IN UNANNOUNCED ON A PRACTISING UNICORN IS MORE THAN IMPOLITE, IT'S DANGEROUS." Rainbow Dash was now a little blue dot against the mighty purple column of Twilight's leg, climbing ever higher in her attempt to reach the giant mare's ear.

"Oh, I hope we can have some fun with this." Pinkie Pie declared. "Twilight's all 'Fee fi fo fum' and we're a bunch of helpless specks. Just think of all the adventures we can have."

"Really, Pinkie." Rarity replied. "I should think we've had more than our fair share of adventures." By now Rainbow Dash was level with Twilight's shoulder and ready to power her way towards the ear.
15113212121.title: Tiny before Twilight

info.brief_description: A set of storylines for size-chainging Anthropomorphic Life Forms.
info.description:
This is a story dedicated to growth and/or shrinking in universes containing Anthropomorphic Life Forms or ALFs. These can be anything from highly anthropomorphic (like PBS's Arthur) to barely anthropomorphic (like Disney's 101 Dalmatians). As such I'll accept just about anything be it Disney or WB or even something not so well known. I ask only these factors:

It must be in character.

It must remain within the canon rating.

Nothing Angsty, growing is preferred to be restricted to protagonists but this is not exclusive.

No adult material.

Other than those restrictions, write that which suits you. If I find something that seems to contradict what I'd intended I might refine the above restrictions or simply do a re-edit to try and bring it into the intended limits.
